overview:
Amy Schrier is CEO of MISSION.tv, a digital platform about making a difference in the world. MISSION.tv creates and curates premium content about global humanitarian issues and travel, and connects audiences with opportunities for philanthropy and activism. MISSION.tv is a for-profit company with a social mission.

Amy is a serial entrepreneur and her first company BLUE (www.bluemagazine.com) was a successful media brand combining the then emerging themes of outdoor recreation, action sports and adventure travel for mainstream audiences. Amy was Founder/CEO of BLUE for 7 years.

BLUE received numerous awards for its compelling editorial and graphic design (ASME: Top 40 Magazine Covers of the past 40 Years, 2005; LIFE magazine: Best Photos of the Year, 1999; Folio: Best Travel Editorial, First Place, 2001; Folio: Best Overall Magazine Design, 2002). BLUE attracted top tier advertisers Patagonia, Microsoft, Prada, Quiksilver, Burton Snowboards, Jeep, Nissan and more. BLUE received press attention in The New York Times, Daily News, VOGUE, Folio:, San Francisco Examiner. Amy regularly appeared on television networks CNN, CNNfn, CNBC, MSNBC, FoxNews as spokesperson for the Adventure Lifestyle trend.

Amy is an adventurous traveler, having visited more than 40 countries worldwide. She has surfed Indonesia, sailed the Bahamas, kayaked Baja, snowboarded across British Columbia/Alberta, scuba-dived Thailand, mountain biked Long Island and adventure raced the Bronx. She has lived with the Maasai in Kenya and volunteered in their school system; she has visited remote areas of Bangladesh to do surf outreach. She is committed to the belief that positive change can be made in the world and makes every effort to be part of that process.

Amy graduated from Cornell University and lives in New York City.
